elements.subject: Theoretical background for Seg-Grad CAM XAI method for video segmentation problems

description.raw: In Sprint 1, User 5492 already documented Seg-Grad CAM as a promising XAI method for image segmentation problems. Create a theoretical concept of **how to extend Seg-Grad-CAM from medical image to video data**. Check if literature already exists on how to extend gradient-based XAI methods to video datasets. Think of own ideas. Add the final concept to the Wiki.
description.html: In Sprint 1, User 5492 already documented Seg-Grad CAM as a promising XAI method for image segmentation problems. Create a theoretical concept of how to extend Seg-Grad-CAM from medical image to video data. Check if literature already exists on how to extend gradient-based XAI methods to video datasets. Think of own ideas. Add the final concept to the Wiki.

elements.subject: Define evaluation metrics and criteria

description.raw: Define evaluation criteria and metrics to evaluate the quality of the XAI approaches (e.g. clarity, relevance, clinical interpretability). Some initial thoughts on evaluation criteria can be found in the orientation phase presentation (https://projects.academiccloud.de/projects/study-project-computer-vision-for-the-medical-domain-1/wiki/goal-presentation-1) and wiki (https://projects.academiccloud.de/projects/study-project-computer-vision-for-the-medical-domain-1/wiki/comparison). An initial set of interesting metrics and their papers can be found in this wiki page (https://projects.academiccloud.de/projects/scrum-group-3-explainability/wiki/evaluation-of-xai-approaches). Extend the last wiki page with the chosen evaluation approach.
description.html: Define evaluation criteria and metrics to evaluate the quality of the XAI approaches (e.g. clarity, relevance, clinical interpretability). An initial set of interesting metrics and their papers can be found in this wiki page (https://projects.academiccloud.de/projects/scrum-group-3-explainability/wiki/evaluation-of-xai-approaches). Extend the last wiki page with the chosen evaluation approach.
